item.title: China Lashed by Typhoon Rivaling Idalia
item.description: Hong Kong meteorologists issued their highest storm alert—the first level-10 typhoon in five years.

item.title: Trump Is Top Choice for Nearly 60% of GOP Voters
item.description: Donald Trump has expanded his dominating lead for the Republican presidential nomination, a new Wall Street Journal poll shows, as GOP primary voters overwhelmingly see his four criminal cases as lacking merit.

item.title: Young Japanese Find It Pays---Double---to Work Abroad
item.description: The wage gap widens with wealthiest nations as the yen falls, driving some to weigh emigration.

item.title: Better Tech Could Save Lives in a World of Bigger, Faster, More Devastating Fires
item.description: We can already see fires start from space, soon after they start. Here’s why we don’t yet have a nationwide system for alerting us when they do—but could someday.

item.title: The Man Who Has Detroit, Wall Street and the White House on Edge
item.description: United Auto Workers President Shawn Fain is throwing out the traditional union playbook and preparing for a strike, possibly against three automakers at once.

item.title: What Michael Jordan Learned From Detroit's Goons
item.description: For a Midwestern teen in the late ’80s and early ’90s, the rivalry between the NBA’s Bulls and Pistons showed how beauty can triumph over brutality

item.title: Tolkien's Biblical Epic
item.description: The long-lasting popularity of ‘The Lord of the Rings’ shows that in a secular age, readers still respond to Judeo-Christian teachings about morality, providence and power.

item.title: A coalition representing the biggest private-equity and hedge funds sued the SEC to block new regulations aimed at giving investors more transparency from asset managers.
item.description: A coalition representing the biggest private-equity and hedge funds sued the SEC to block new regulations aimed at giving investors more transparency from asset managers.

item.title: The S&P 500 rose Friday, finishing its best weekly performance since June. The broad index gained 0.2%, while the Dow added 0.3% and the Nasdaq eased less than 0.1%.
item.description: The S&P 500 rose Friday, finishing its best weekly performance since June. The broad index gained 0.2%, while the Dow added 0.3% and the Nasdaq eased less than 0.1%.

item.title: U.S. employers added 3.1 million jobs during the past 12 months, including 187,000 in August, the Labor Department said, offering evidence that the pandemic and policy responses made the economyresilient to the Fed's rate increases.
item.description: U.S. employers added 3.1 million jobs during the past 12 months, including 187,000 in August, the Labor Department said, offering evidence that the pandemic and policy responses made the economy resilient to the Fed’s rate increases.

item.title: British chip designer Arm is eyeing a target valuation between $50 billion and $55 billion for its IPO.
item.description: British chip designer Arm is eyeing a target valuation between $50 billion and $55 billion for its IPO.

item.title: Rosalind Brewer has stepped down as CEO of Walgreens less than three years after taking on the role.
item.description: Rosalind Brewer has stepped down as CEO of Walgreens less than three years after taking on the role.

item.title: Nursing homes will have to maintain minimum staffing levels under a Biden administration proposal despite furious lobbying from the industry.
item.description: Nursing homes will have to maintain minimum staffing levels under a Biden administration proposal despite furious lobbying from the industry.

item.title: As residents of Florida and South Carolina struggle with the aftermath of storm Idalia, southern China is being lashed by a cyclone that may prove even more powerful.
item.description: As residents of Florida and South Carolina struggle with the aftermath of storm Idalia, southern China is being lashed by a cyclone that may prove even more powerful.

item.title: Died: Mohamed Al Fayed, 94, former owner of Harrods department store whose son Dodi died alongside Princess Diana in 1997.
item.description: Died: Mohamed Al Fayed, 94, former owner of Harrods department store whose son Dodi died alongside Princess Diana in 1997.

item.title: Ecuador's security crisis worsened after car bombs exploded in several Andean cities, while inmates took dozens of prison guards hostage and prosecutors asked for more police protection.
item.description: Ecuador’s security crisis worsened after car bombs exploded in several Andean cities, while inmates took dozens of prison guards hostage and prosecutors asked for more police protection.

item.title: Donald Trump has expanded his dominating lead for the Republican presidential nomination, a new WSJ poll shows, as GOP primary voters overwhelmingly see his four criminal prosecutions as lacking merit.
item.description: Donald Trump has expanded his dominating lead for the Republican presidential nomination, a new WSJ poll shows, as GOP primary voters overwhelmingly see his four criminal prosecutions as lacking merit.

item.title: The FTC said it reached an agreement that would end its legal challenge of drugmaker Amgen's $27.8 billion deal to buy Horizon Therapeutics.
item.description: The FTC said it reached an agreement that would end its legal challenge of drugmaker Amgen’s $27.8 billion deal to buy Horizon Therapeutics.
